Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
Kanchou, if you would just turn around for a second I could get a better look.
Kumano, you realize we have Morganas approaching us, right?
Huh? Oh, yeah, I know. I'm... well, I wanted it to be a surprise, but I'm trying to draw you.
Me? Why?
I think I should probably keep it a surprise.

Fields.MenuText: You know what? I probably don't want to know.
I'll remember this next time I know something you don't.
Should I start guessing?

Fields.DialogueText: It's nothing weird or anything. I just want to surprise you when it's ready.
Oh, don't be mad. You'll know why soon enough, Kanchou.
You'd never guess, I wouldn't tell you if you did anyway, and futility depresses me.
If you'd stay still for just thirty seconds I could complete a quick outline of you to work from.
Why don't you just draw me after the battle?
It's a lot harder than you might think to draw from memory, to say nothing of the Morganas. They're just so bizarre.
Morganas? ... Never mind. We'll work out a solution later. We're almost on top of them.
You really want to help me?
Of course. After we make it out of this fight. Now, get your head in the game.
Never left it.
@BATTLE
So I need to get a nice, long, close-up look at a Morgana.
Huh. There's a sentence you don't hear very often.
It worked on you. This is just that with a few extra variables. What are your ideas?

Fields.MenuText: How about you just don't?
We could try sneaking up on a Morgana and taking a bunch of pictures.
You don't have any ideas of your own?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm already set on doing this, Kanchou. One way or another. So you might as well help me.
I'm not exactly the sneakiest. Plus, we're going to need to get real close and personal.
None that have worked. That's why I need your help.
Hmmm... Okay, let's start workshopping a little here. What exactly do you need?
Well, I'd prefer the chance to spend a few good minutes examining a Morgana from every angle.
Every angle? And you'd prefer to be pretty close, I'm guessing.
Inches from it. Though I know how unreasonable that sounds. But it would be so worth it!
It is pretty unreasonable. That doesn't mean I can't make it happen for you.
What are you saying, Kanchou? You got something up your sleeves?
*ALARM*
I do, but let's take care of these annoyances first.
Okay, but I might bring my sketchpad into battle with me. You never know when I might get a good chance.
Are you sure that's a good—
Relax, Kanchou. I can multitask.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I love a crazy plan, Kanchou. And this is one of the craziest I've ever heard.
It'll work. We might get a little scratched up, but you'll get what you need.
Oh, I'm sure it'll work, it's just that---I mean, you don't even know what I need this for. You're really putting a lot of faith in me, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: Not any more than I usually have, Kumano. I trust you.
Yeah, I am. Don't let me down, Kumano.
Well, I'm mostly doing this because it sounds fun. Mostly.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Kanchou. That means a lot to me.
I'd never dream of it. This will all be worth it.
It does, doesn't it? I mean, fun and dangerous, but what's a little danger if you get to enjoy it?
Captain, the Morganas are nearing!
All right, Kumano, which one catches your fancy the most?
Hmmm... I really like the big one in the back. It'd be perfect.
The big one it is. Get your pen and paper ready. I'll have your model to you in short order.
All right, crew, take all the Morganas out except for that one. The one in back we shoot to cripple.
Now let's get out there and destroy the rest of them!
@BATTLE
That was great, Kanchou! Look at all these amazing sketches I got!
Wow, they actually look great.
What do you mean "actually?"
Captain, what were you thinking? That was incredibly dangerous!

Fields.MenuText: You're right, I shouldn't have gotten the fish tacos.
I assume you're talking about leaving that one Morgana alone.
Care to specify? You seem to be angry about a lot of things.

Fields.DialogueText: That's not what I'm talking about, and you know it.
Yeah, what else would I be shouting about?
Well...that might be true, but this is a big one.
Battling Morganas is already risky enough. When you play with them like that, you might as well be playing Russian roulette with a full cylinder.
You don't think you might be overreacting a little? We were never in any danger.
Of course you think that. It was your insane idea in the first place.
Actually, it was the kanchou's idea. And I'm very proud of it.
What? You came up with that ridiculous plan?
Yes, and you don't have to worry anymore. It was just a one-time thing. It won't have to happen again. Right, Kumano?
Exactly. I got what I needed. And then some.
Was whatever you needed important enough to risk—
*ALARM*
Sounds like this fight can wait until we've taken care of that one.
Think you can pull that stick out of your butt long enough to shoot some Morganas?
Depends. Could I sit for a portrait if I dipped it in paint!?
Okay, can we just get in position already?
@BATTLE
You're always shouting.
Kumano, what's that you're making there? Is that a card?
Don't look! You'll ruin the surprise of it!

Fields.MenuText: I see... This must have to do with why you needed to draw the Morgana.
All right, turning around. I feel like I walked into the room while you were changing.
Oh, is it a birthday card? Are you surprising someone for their birthday?

Fields.DialogueText: Stop guessing! You're too smart for your own good, Kanchou.
I wish. I'd actually be less embarrassed by that.
Not even close. I'm not one of those "the crew are my family" Belles.
If you must know, this is all about that little secret I've been working on.
I'm waiting for more details.
Don't worry, you'll have your details soon. I need to work out a few issues before it's ready for a trial run.
Trial run?
Don't worry about it... Worry, rather, about the Morganas approaching from the north.
Convenient timing. I hope your little secret will be ready soon. I'm getting impatient.
You've waited this long. You can wait until after we've sunk a few more Morganas.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, do you think you have a little time to do me a favor?

Fields.MenuText: A favor? All right, but you'll owe me one.
Certainly, ask away.
Nothing dangerous, I hope.

Fields.DialogueText: That wouldn't be the worst thing in the world.
So bold. I assure you it's not dangerous.
Nothing dangerous, I assure you.
I was hoping you could test my game with me.
Your game? You've finished it? That's fantastic!
I think it's in a functional state, but the mechanics need some playtesting.
Well, yeah, let's play. I've been looking forward to it for a while.
Excellent! This should be a good opportunity to show off my art as well. I think you'll be pleasantly-
*ALARM*
Sounds like we'll have to play after we take care of some Morganas.
Curse those spooky fuddy-duddies. Fine, but right after!
@BATTLE
So one side plays as the Morganas and the other plays as the Belles, right?
Exactly. And they each have their own sets of cards.
Okay, now everything is starting to add up.
Yeah, this was why I needed to get close to the Morganas. Think it was worth it?
With the illustrations on these cards? I'd certainly say so. You did a wonderful job, Kumano.
Thanks, Kanchou. Now, which side would you like to play?

Fields.MenuText: Morganas. It could be fun to play as the bad side for once.
Belles. I'll stick with what I know.
You choose. I don't have a preference.

Fields.DialogueText: Then here you go. Just don't let evil get to your head.
Smart choice. We are the best, after all.
Fine, then. You can be Morganas. I like the Belles better.
The Morgana cards look pretty great, but...
But what?
Well... could you not get close to a Belle, or something?
Quiet, you. Belles are harder to draw. I'm not good with faces and... well, people in general. Drawing Morganas is a lot more like drawing plants or landscapes, really.
That actually makes sense, I guess.
I'm not a great artist anyway. I'll have them all redrawn if the game takes off.
... Ookini. I was especially careful with--
*ALARM*
Hey, what do you know? The real Morganas are attacking before the fake ones could.
We'll have to play later, I guess. At least I got the chance to explain the rules.
I promise not to forget them.
You better not. That'd be incredibly annoying.
Hmm?
... Not a dealbreaker, but annoying.
Ignore me, Kanchou. To battle!
@BATTLE
Hey, this one of me is actually pretty good.
Sin's combat air patrol cancels her out even if she's not participating in my offensive action. Valiant effort, Kanchou, but my Asphyxiation carries the day.
Dang it, I was almost back in the game! My Mahan was going to put giant holes in your formation.
You should've sacrificed your Kumano for the Nine Lives Ship bonus. That's where you went wrong. Kaga would have saved you if that had been active.

Fields.MenuText: Wow, I didn't even see that. Maybe I'm not good at this game.
I just couldn't bring myself to do it. It seemed too cruel.
I doubt that would've worked. You're just too ruthless when you're playing Morganas.

Fields.DialogueText: You're just starting out. I'm sure you'll get better.
It's just a card, Kanchou. You don't have to worry about a card when you've got the real one right here.
That's the playstyle I'm trying to encourage for them.
But... you know, it seems too easy to win with the Morganas. Do you think I need to balance it a little more?
Maybe. I mean, in my experience, the Belles are always kicking Morgana ass.
You have a point, Kanchou. But a game isn't fun unless both sides have a chance to win.
Then maybe balance it a little more. It feels a little easy for the Morganas to snowball off of a couple of decent skirmishes. Other than that, though, it seems like a great game.
Obviously. I made it.
Captain, we've got Morganas inbound—what's that?
Art project.
Sound the alarm.
Seriously, what is that?
That's the sound of the alarm not going off. Let's go fix that.
@BATTLE
Doesn't my Kaga get an opportunity to retaliate with her bombers? She ignores close-range restrictions.
Honmani? Are you sure you want to do that, Kanchou?
Sure I'm sure. I've got a lot riding on this brawl phase. When you're behind, maximize risk.
... Indeed. All right, Asphyxiation launches the reserve torpedoes she's banked, boosted by Despair's passive aura. And I'm tapping this captured torpedo crew to make it stick.
No! That's impossible. Bulldog should have survived that! Her Heart of Oak ability-
Doesn't apply to collisions. It's your first match. You'll get better.
Screw it, I don't care about your stupid game. I've got better stuff to do.

Fields.MenuText: Teaching others your game?
Was he as easy to beat as I was?
Do the Belles have a victory yet?

Fields.DialogueText: Games are more fun when there are more players.
Easier. But it was his first game. He'll get better. And so will you.
Pending some tweaking. It's almost in a balance space I like.
Is there a reason you used him to test the balance? Haven't you bruised his ego enough?
He wanted to learn. I needed to teach it to someone. Win-win, right?
Hey, what was that you guys were playing before? Can I play?
Oh, uh, sure. I'll have to teach you first.
I've got time.
*ALARM*
Actually, you don't.
After, then.
Sure, sounds good. Say, that's a pretty good dolphin.
Kumano?
... It's supposed to be Fubuki.
You're improving. I think it looks good.
After this battle, it's back to the drawing board. For the foreseeable future.
@BATTLE
Can't disengage... my Vestures are all tapped... that looks like the game. Well done, Kanchou!
I beat you, finally.
Good job. See, I said you could do it.

Fields.MenuText: I got lucky.
Feels great to win. Want to go again?
I knew I could do it if the game was fair.

Fields.DialogueText: You shouldn't go thanking luck for every little victory. Get good enough and you make your own.
Not just yet. We wouldn't want you getting addicted.
I haven't made too many balance changes. I think you're starting to think more strategically. More like a Belle.
Hey, so you know... the crew have been asking me about the game.
Yeah, I've heard some of them talking about it. They're fighting over who gets to play you.
I do like being fought over. Hopefully they don't tire themselves out by the time I have a chance to clobber them.
I'll have to keep that in mind. Oh, that reminds me... does your game have a name yet?
Unfortunately, no. You know how bad I am with those.
Yeah, I guess it's kind of weird for a popular game to go unnamed.
"Belle Collection?" "Blue Road?" No, those are no good...
We can brainstorm. It shouldn't take too long to come up with something.
*ALARM*
Looks like the queen's presence is required.
You're going to get used to that, aren't you.
Quicker than even I thought possible.
@BATTLE
Maybe you need to make more cards. They'd be able to practice before they took on the empress.
You flatter me, Kanchou. But there's only one empress. Now, "Queen Kumano" does have a nice ring to it...
Kumano?
It's open!
What the hell are you doing?
Mass production. It's the downside of popularity.

Fields.MenuText: At least you went with cards and not statuettes.
How many cards have you made?
At this rate you'll be better than a professional artist.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, that would be much worse. I'm not that good with a knife. If I weren't a Belle I'd probably be down a digit.
I stopped counting. Something around a thousand... maybe more.
They all started somewhere. See, you can even track my progress.
Here, you can help by binding all the cards together in packs.
Sure. I can work a rubber band.
So what did you want?
I was coming to work on the name.
Well, I'm a little busy right now.
*ALARM*
Now I'm busier.
I guess I'll wait for you to come to me.
Probably for the best. I'm a busy girl.
@BATTLE
Morgana Wars?
I'm not sure I want war in the title.
Why? It's basically a war game.
...How about just Victory?
That would suck for the loser. It'd be like rubbing their face in the title itself.
Okay, well, this has been going on for too long. We just need to come up with a name and stick with it.
So just toss out the first thing we can think of?
Sure, sounds good enough.

Fields.MenuText: Victory Belles.
Belle-cheesi?
Yu-Gi-Belle.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmmm, that's pretty good for a placeholder. Seems a little trite for the final title, though.
Focus, Kanchou. This isn't a board game.
Now you're just tossing together characters.
*ALARM*
Sounds like we're out of time. I guess that'll have to do.
Great, then it's settled. You know, there should really be a box to carry it in...
I'll steal some ammunition boxes. One more art project...
@BATTLE
Kanchou, Kanchou, Kanchou!
You sound happy.
The game's caught like wildfire, Kanchou. Everyone on the ship is playing!
That's great! So what brings you here?
Well, I know that things go in and out of style like that. So I was hoping to capitalize on the game's current popularity. Strike while that wildfire's heating the iron, as it were.

Fields.MenuText: I'm guessing you have something in mind?
Sounds like you want to do something big. And distracting.
Whatever it is, I'm on board. Let's do it.

Fields.DialogueText: I do. I always do. My mind never stops thinking.
Maybe a little, but it's nothing our crew can't handle.
I'm glad you're so agreeable. Especially since what I'm asking for is pretty big.
I want to throw a tournament. A tournament for the whole crew to compete to see who's the best player.
A tournament, huh? Sounds interesting.
So you're on board?
Sure. Just, uh, tournaments usually have prizes. So what does the winner get?
Working on that. I want it to be something they can be proud of... and something I can be proud of too.
Maybe a custom card box?
Well, they're all custom, Kanchou. I'm making them.
How are they coming?
... Getting better.
You know, you've really improved. I can't wait to see what you've got in store for us.
Thanks, Kanchou. That means a lot to me.
Was there something else?
... It'll have to wait. We're heading into a fight!
@BATTLE
In truth, Kanchou, I had not planned this far ahead.
Then it'll be all the more impressive when you wing it. Up on the table.
Gather around, gather all! It's the time you've all been waiting for!

Fields.MenuText: Got something in mind, Kumano?
Yeah, everyone, listen up! You're going to want to hear this!
Look at ‘em go. They're gathering around like a bunch of sheep!

Fields.DialogueText: Wait and see.
Thanks for the help, but I think I've got this.
That's a horrible thing to call your crew, Kanchou. Even if they are easily led.
It's time for the event you've all been waiting for! It's time for the tournament to begin!
*EXCITED MUTTERING*
You'll all place your names in this box and I'll assemble the bracket.
Are there prizes?
Well, I'm happy you asked! There will be prizes for tenth through first place. And the grand prize will be awarded to the winner... if they can beat me.
*ALARM*
Specifics will be determined based on number of entrants and amount of interest. Please enter your names as soon as possible and have a nice day! Dismissed to general quarters!
Well, that went better than expected.
I'm optimistic about turnout.
Those prizes certainly don't hurt. Ten of them, huh? That's ambitious.
... Uzai. What have I gotten myself into?
@BATTLE
Well, I certainly did wing it.
Look at all these names! This has to be most of my complement...

Fields.MenuText: Eh, I've seen more.
Those are all for your tournament? No way.
That's definitely a lot.

Fields.DialogueText: I seriously doubt that. Don't bother hiding it. I know you're impressed.
Yes way. I told you the game was popular.
A lot!? It's more than a lot. I could swim through all of these!
If you're going to just roll around in those, you'd better make room for me.
Ha ha, stop, these are my names! Get your own.
Okay, okay...that's enough fun. It's time to get to work.
You can make work fun too. If you do it right.
Obviously. That's why I'm always having fun. Every waking moment...
*ALARM*
Ah! Morgana break.
Hey, wait—*sigh* Sure, leave the giant mess of paper slips for me to clean up.
@BATTLE
Yeah, from my crew!
Hey, Kanchou, I was putting together the brackets and I realized you forgot to put your name in.
Oh, yeah, about that...
You're going to compete, aren't you?

Fields.MenuText: I'm not all that competitive.
Of course I am. I must've just forgot.
Depends on what the prize is.

Fields.DialogueText: You? Not competitive? I don't believe that for a second.
You're either super forgetful or you don't actually want to play.
Trust me, it'll be something great. You'll be sorry if you don't at least try to win it.
Great, I'll see you in the preliminaries. We'll separate the men from the mice.
Sounds great. Just remember that we are still on patrol for Morganas.
I've got it all under control. It just wouldn't be the same without you there.
I suppose I am pretty great, aren't I?
Whether you believe it or not, it's true.
Competition is healthy. It gives you drive to improve.
I'm just going to add your name in. Is that all right?
I... guess so.
No, I forget a lot of things. I'd give you examples, but...I forgot ‘em.
I'm just going to add your name in. Is that all right?
Sure. I'll be sure not to forget when my match is.
Hmmmm, sounds tempting.
I'm just going to add your name in. Is that all right?
Yeah, okay, but it better be an amazing prize.
Don't spoil it, Kanchou. You've been helping me test this from the beginning and you've supported me through it. It wouldn't be complete if you didn't participate.
I happen to think you make a great game. And your art's been getting really good, as well. I definitely want to see that through to...
To what?
Wherever.
*ALARM*
I'll hold you to that.
You'd better.
@BATTLE
Everyone's having so much fun! And they're playing my game!
Yeah, I know. I'm one of those people.
It just... makes me really happy.
Kumano, I'm in the middle of a match.
Oh, sorry, I'll just watch quietly.
*ALARM*
Morganas!? Just when things were getting heated up.
Okay, everyone, get in position. We've got a fight on our hands!
Leave everything where it is. We can pick up right where we left off after the battle.
You think the cards are going to stay in place while there are explosions rocking the ship?
I've got a plan. Also: tape.

Fields.MenuText: We kind of need you on deck.
Throw me some, I'll help.
Good luck with that. I'll be making sure the ship doesn't sink.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll be quick about it!
We can't both be down here. Someone has to deal with the Morganas.
I'll be right there to help. Just gotta finish this!
*BOOM*
Oh, no! They're getting all over the place!
@BATTLE
... You know, as long as Venom's in the dive state, you can-
Hey, no backseat gaming!
Shutting up.
That's another down. One more step to that grand prize.
Dang, I was close too. Good game.
He's gotten better. Not as good as me, but better.
Yeah, I figured all he needed was a little practice. At this rate he could win the grand prize.
That reminds me, what are the prizes? What are we competing for?
I guess I can tell you. It's a set of new cards. I'm going to start making expansion packs, and the winners get the first ones in custom boxes.

Fields.MenuText: And all of it handmade. That's a lot of work you'll be going through.
New cards, huh? It's a good thing you put my name in.
Just make sure you don't get distracted from the real Morganas.

Fields.DialogueText: Well worth it. It'll make them all the more unique.
I knew you'd love it.
If anything, I'll get more focused on them. I'll need more designs, after all.
And that's not even the grand prize. I've got something special in mind for whoever can beat me.
And that is?
Beat me and find out.
Kumano, I'm coming for you!
I'll be right here. Bring it on!
*ALARM*
Sounds like the Morganas thought you were talking to them.
Well, at least they waited for the match to be over this time.
@BATTLE
You think... other crews would like my game?

Fields.MenuText: Of course. I mean, we can't get enough of it.
Is that what you want? For your game to spread to the four corners of the map?
Maybe... but you'd have to do a hell of a lot of work.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah... It's really popular, isn't it?
Creating something that everyone loves, something lasting... Sounds nice, doesn't it?
You're right about that. I'd have to make enough cards for a whole other ship.
Whether you want it to spread or not, you should probably wait until Morganas only exist in history and the game.
You're right again. I should keep my head in the game.
I thought you said it always was.
Heh, right. I did say that, didn't I? Must have been distracted.
Now would be a terrible time to drop the ball.
You don't have to worry about that. I've still got my eyes out for Morganas.
Are there any nearby?
No, but we'll find some. They're never too far away.
@BATTLE
What are you doing in here? You're late for your match.
What? Oh, crap, I completely forgot. I'll be right there!
Seriously, you just forgot? What was so much more important than my tournament?

Fields.MenuText: I just had a lot of paperwork I needed to catch up on.
Honestly? I was practicing. I want to make sure I get that grand prize.
My game isn't the whole world. I've got lots of important captain things to do too.

Fields.DialogueText: Paperwork? Forget about your paperwork! It'll be there when you get back!
You don't have to worry so much. You'll do much better if you just stay relaxed.
Kanchou things? Yeah, sounds reeeeal official.
Okay, I'll get my cards and meet you down there.
Just hurry up. Your opponent's been waiting for you.
*ALARM*
Sounds like he'll have to wait a little while longer.
I'll make it quick. We're all hungry for the semifinals.
@BATTLE
Oh, we have a winner!
Woooo!
*Cheering Crowd*
So I guess he'll be my opponent for the grand prize?
No, I'm your opponent for the grand prize. He'll be your opponent for the first place prize.

Fields.MenuText: Getting nervous yet?
Same difference. I'm sure I can take you.
I hope you're rooting for me.

Fields.DialogueText: Nah, you're both still miles behind me.
Hah, sure you can. We'll see how cocky you are when the battle starts.
Of course I am. You just might need a little luck.
Anyway, we have some time before finals. I'm going to make sure we're clear of Morganas.
Good idea. We wouldn't want them interrupting my final match.
Exactly. Just spend your time getting psyched up.
@BATTLE
I thought you didn't believe in luck.
I believe in luck. Otherwise, how would I make my own?
So you're my opponent this time, Captain?
Yeah, it should be fun.
I hope you're not expecting me to go easy on you.

Fields.MenuText: You'd better. I am your captain, after all.
No, of course not. But don't worry. I won't beat you down too hard.
It's just a game. Let's have some fun.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmph, fine. I'll go easy on you. I'll still win, but it won't leave a bruise.
Heh. Yeah, we'll see about that.
Yeah, whatever. I'll have fun when I've won that grand prize.
All right, are you both ready to play?
Hell yeah.
I'm good to go.
Then have at it!
@BATTLE
And we have a winner!
Phew, good game. It was close.
Damn it. Whatever... I knew I shouldn't have played the Morganas.
Excuses, excuses.
Grr...
You and me now?
We can take a break first. You look like you need to catch your breath.
*ALARM*
Damn it! I was just about to wipe the floor with you.
Look at it this way. Now we can all win.
All right, everyone, it's time for the grand finale!
*Crowd Cheering*

Fields.MenuText: You ain't seen nothing yet!
Let's get ready to battle!
I don't know what to say here. So just...go!

Fields.DialogueText: That's a promise, Kanchou. You'd better not hold back.
Make it a good one or I'll never forgive you.
This is why I host these things.
Don't go easy on me, okay?
Wouldn't dream of it. You're playing the Morganas, after all.
Scared, Kanchou? Don't be. You know how I've balanced them.
So it'll be all the more satisfying when I beat you with your own rules!
*ALARM*
I'll make sure we survive, Kanchou. The world must witness our battle!
Well, you've forced my hand. I'm tapping my Vestures and blowing all my points on Nevada's Luck Be A Lady ability. That lets me reroll... all of my shots this round.
Bold move! But it leaves you completely exposed should it fail.
That's a risk I'm just going to have to take.
Come at me, then!
Damn it. We need to get to general quarters right now. This group's supposed to be a big one.
@BATTLE
Another miss! That's the last one I needed. Cowardice's passive is fully charged. Half accuracy in your next engagement, Kanchou!
All right, that's... a hit. Hit. Hit. Hit. Hit...
Grr... Lucky shots, Kanchou, but you'll have to do better than that. Corruption's leading the formation for a reason! I'll just cannibalize her for a full heal and-
Oh, and don't forget Boiky's Fires of Revolution. Blast radius increases to... gee, looks like everywhere.
Well, that still leaves me with the escorts...
Lexington's got them covered. Holding my planes hurt in the short run... but it paid off. Game?
Game. Well played, Kanchou.
Damn, I was just getting warmed up!
There will be many more. Bet on that.
All right, you're the top... nine players? We're missing one.
He's still pissed about losing to you.
Okay, well, I guess the nine of you will be getting your congratulatory expansion packs.

Fields.MenuText: I can bring him his.
I guess he doesn't want his pack.
Can I have his?

Fields.DialogueText: I'll take care of it, Kanchou. Don't worry about it.
Who wouldn't want their pack? He'd have to be crazy.
Don't get greedy. You're already getting the grand prize.
So, you nine, approach the table and grab the box of your choice.
I guess I'll pick... this one. You've really outdone yourself with these! Look at the detail on that Morgana...
Be wary: each pack has ten out of the fifty new cards, and there are no reprints.
Can we trade cards?
I encourage it! The more diverse the card combinations, the better.
*ALARM*
We can do that later. Everyone pocket your new toys and get in position!
Ahem. Kanchou, you should take your own advice.
I know, I know, I'm just checking out what I got. Ohhh, this one's sparkly.
Yes, I'm a regular Hokusai. Head in the game, remember?
@BATTLE
Kanchou, I've got a surprise for you.

Fields.MenuText: A good one, I hope.
Well, I've got paperwork to catch up on.
Hope you're not about to ask for another tournament.

Fields.DialogueText: A very good one. You'll love it, I'm sure.
Your paperwork isn't going anywhere. Come on, just take a little break.
Nah, those will be few and far between.
So what's your surprise?
Close your eyes.
Close my eyes? Why?
Oh, just close ‘em already.
Okay, closed. Now what?
Open them.
Kumano, that painting... that's... me?
And I had a backup if anyone else won, of course. In any event... this was a special gift, only for you.
Hmmm. A one-time gift, or will there be more kisses in the future?
Maybe. You might have to beat me in my game again first.
*ALARM*
Always, Kanchou. When defeat is as sweet as victory... you can never be defeated.
Okay, fine.
I'm glad you recognize it.
How could I not? It's beautiful! It's like the card you made of me, but... bigger.
Thank you, Kanchou. I... well, it's sort of what I was trying to express all along with my art.
Me specifically?
Any artist wants to show the world how they perceive it. It took a lot of practice for me to depict what I saw in you. Strength... passion... not to mention beauty.
I... thank you, Kumano. It's your best work yet.
You inspired and supported me to this point. I thought it appropriate to include you in it.
Oh, and this, if you'll have it...
Another time. You'd better make me work for it.
